Sentencas: Typical manganese cobalt spinel oxide (MCO) coating processes involve both a reduction and an oxidation heat treatment to produce dense and well adherent coatings on metallic interconnects for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Spinel coatings on metallic interconnects: Effect of reduction heat treatment on performance

Sentencas: In a high volume production, to achieve the required cycle-time and capacity throughput, it is necessary to perform the reduction heat treatment in a continuous manner rather than batch firing.
Titulo: Spinel coatings on metallic interconnects: Effect of reduction heat treatment on performance

Sentencas: However, the continuous reduction heat treatment in furnaces requires large capital investments and also incurs high operating costs.
Titulo: Spinel coatings on metallic interconnects: Effect of reduction heat treatment on performance

Sentencas: Therefore, it is the reduction heat treatment that contributes to a significant portion of overall coating costs.
Titulo: Spinel coatings on metallic interconnects: Effect of reduction heat treatment on performance

Sentencas: For reduced cost and increased throughput, it would be preferable to eliminate the reduction heat treatment and oxidize the green coatings directly.
Titulo: Spinel coatings on metallic interconnects: Effect of reduction heat treatment on performance

Sentencas: However, it is anticipated that coatings without the reduction heat treatment would have poor adherence and density which would result in reduced functionality.
Titulo: Spinel coatings on metallic interconnects: Effect of reduction heat treatment on performance

Sentencas: In the present paper, the performances of MCO coatings processed with and without the reduction heat treatments are evaluated in terms of interfacial fracture energy from mechanical bend tests and area specific resistance (ASR) from electrical tests.
Titulo: Spinel coatings on metallic interconnects: Effect of reduction heat treatment on performance

Sentencas: Quantifying these mechanical and electrical properties allows for assessment of the benefits of the reduction firing.
Titulo: Spinel coatings on metallic interconnects: Effect of reduction heat treatment on performance
